intro: Inga leiocalycina, commonly known as the Hawaiian inga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, flat pods that contain seeds. Inga leiocalycina plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential in ecological restoration projects.
